solution_line_template: First, we need to determine how many feet Ian runs in a week. We begin this by multiplying the number of laps by the number of feet per lap, performing {laps_per_day}*{feet_per_lap}= <<{laps_per_day}*{feet_per_lap}={feet_per_day}>>{feet_per_day} feet per day.
Since there are {days} days in the period being measured, this means Ian runs {feet_per_day}*{days}= <<{feet_per_day}*{days}={total_feet}>>{total_feet} feet jogged.

Since it takes {feet_per_calorie} feet of jogging to burn a calorie, this means Ian burns {total_feet}/{feet_per_calorie}=<<{total_feet}/{feet_per_calorie}={calories_burned}>>{calories_burned} calories burned jogging throughout the week.
